ExternalReferences.DisorderMappingRelation: E (Exact mapping: the two concepts are equivalent)

TextSection.Contents: A rare constitutional hemolytic anemia characterized by a low 6-phosphogluconate dehydrogenase activity in the erythrocytes which clinically manifests with a well-compensated chronic nonspherocytic hemolytic anemia and transient hemolytic periods with jaundice.

Parent.Label: Hemolytic anemia due to hexose monophosphate shunt and glutathione metabolism anomalies
